      • logToCal

        public static void logToCal(logLevel level,
                            java.lang.String component,
                            java.lang.String message)
        Asynchronously Log INFO+ messages to CAL. DEBUG logs will be pushed to logcat only Use with caution from Native Shim as it could potentially lead to a dead lock

      • initialize

        public static void initialize(android.content.Context context,
                              RetailSDK.AppState appState)
                       throws RetailSDKException
        This is the first call you should make to the PayPal Retail SDK (typically in application startup, but if you are using the SDK only in certain cases or for certain customers, then at the appropriate time)
        Throws:
        RetailSDKException

      • getLocationService

        public static LocationService getLocationService()
        If for some reason you want to shutdown all SDK activity and uninitialize the SDK, call shutdownSDK. You will need to call initializeSDK and initializeMerchant again to start using the SDK afterwards.

      • initializeMerchant

        public static void initializeMerchant(java.lang.String token,
                                      java.lang.String repository,
                                      RetailSDK.MerchantInitializedCallback callback)
        Once you have retrieved a token for your merchant (typically from a backend server), call initializeMerchant and wait for the completionHandler to be called before doing more SDK operations.

      • InitializeMerchant

        public static void InitializeMerchant(PPHMerchant merchant,

      • createTransaction

        @Deprecated
public static TransactionContext createTransaction(Invoice invoice)
        Deprecated. use getTransactionManager.createNewTransaction()
        This is the primary starting point for taking a payment. First, create an invoice, then create a transaction, then begin the transaction to have the SDK listen for events and go through the relevant flows for a payment type.

      • setCurrentApplicationActivity

        public static void setCurrentApplicationActivity(android.app.Activity activity)
        At various points during a transaction flow we need to present UI. Typically, before you kick off a transaction flow you should call this method to give us the launching point for our activities.
        Parameters:
        activity - The foreground activity for your application

      • setNetworkInterceptor

        public static void setNetworkInterceptor(RetailSDK.NetworkInterceptorCallback interceptor)
        Provide an interceptor for all HTTP calls made by the SDK
        Parameters:
        interceptor - Custom implementation to handle SDK network requests
